descriptionMarkdown:
This array is meant to **_respond_** to a low-Gas situation. That is why it is "On-Demand" instead of constant production (I assume you're using an Advanced Refinery to do the constant production)

#### HOW TO USE

  1. Set desired MAXIMUM PetroGas level in the Constant Combinator (C.C.)
  2. Link ONE PetroGas tank to the **_OUTPUT_** of the upper (`MUL`) Arithmetic Combinator (A.C.) [in the image, a green arrow points to the location. Remember: OUTput, not input!]
  3. (Optionally) Set the divisor in the lower (`DIV`) A.C. to your liking; this divisor represents the "steps" between successively lower pumps. Defaults to `1000`.
  4. Feed Crude Oil to the piping between the 2 columns, and feed the outputs of the pumps to the PetroGas tank farm
  5. Provide power to all refineries, pumps, and Combinators; using Substations is recommended, but you can also use poles if you prefer.

Default values are:
  * MAX level set to `22k`
  * Divisor set to `1k`

This results in:
  * 1st pump (top left) activates when PetroGas level drops under `22k` <== "MAX" level set in the C.C.
  * 2nd pump (top right) activates when PetroGas level drops under 21k
  * 3rd pump (left, 2nd from top) activates when PetroGas level drops under 20k
  * ... and so on ...

-----

Personally, I lay out my petrochem setion like this:

* Crude Oil ==> Advanced Refinery (AdvRef) ==> Tank Farms for PetroGas, LightOil, HeavyOil.

* HeavyOil ==> Lubricant. If Lubricant tank farm is full, activate cracking ==> LightOil

* LightOil ==> Solid Fuel. If Solid Fuel storage is full, this causes LightOil tank farm to be full, which activates cracking ==> PetroGas

* PetroGas ==> the usual stuff (plastic, sulfur, etc.)

When the Main Bus Factory is running full tilt, the demand will consume a _huge_ amount of PetroGas, beyond the capability of AdvRev + LigthOilCrack. The level drops, and that's when the On-Demand Array activates gradually.

-----

#### HOW IT WORKS

> The C.C. generates a constant PetroGas value of MAX.

> `MUL` multiplies this by `-1`, and adds the result to the reading from the PetroGas Tank.

> `MUL_out = (MAX * -1) + PetroGas_level`

> So if `PetroGas_level` is greater than MAX, `MUL_out` will be **negative**

> `DIV` performs _integer division_ of `MUL_out` by the scale factor.

> `DIV_out = MUL_out / ScaleFactor`

> The pumps are configured to be enabled, from top to bottom, on `DIV_out < 0`, `DIV_out < -1`, `DIV_out < -2`, and so on.
title: On-Demand Petroleum Gas Refinery Array
